## R Markdown
```{r}
library(tidyverse)
library(readr)
library(dplyr)
```

Load in data
```{r}

spg <- read_delim("complete.csv", ";", 
    escape_double = FALSE, trim_ws = TRUE)
View(spg)
```
Create ID
```{r}
spg$ID <- seq.int(nrow(spg))

# Make all answers numeric perhaps? Give them the number from 1 to 5
spg[spg == "Enig"] <- "5"
spg[spg == "Delvis enig"] <- "4"
spg[spg == "Hverken eller"] <- "3"
spg[spg == "Delvis uenig"] <- "2"
spg[spg == "Uenig"] <- "1"

df <- spg

# For some of the columns, it should be reversed. Make these specific columns reversed.

df[,2:18] <- sapply(df[,2:18],as.numeric)

cols = c("intro_3", "intro_5", "oplys_3", "insp_2", "insp_3", "insp_4", "nudge_1", "nudge_2")

df[ ,cols] = 6 - df[ ,cols]
```
